etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in Gerard de Malynes (fl. 1585–1641), merchant and writer on economics. Partly from Spanish premio, and partly from Italian premio, both from classical Latin praemium

definitions: A premium; (in early use especially) an insurance premium.

notes.text: Now chiefly historical except (in non-naturalized use) in the proper names of prizes and awards in Spanish and Italian.
